body_html:
Thanks easye. I have a feeling it's a file structure problem...

I cd to a models-master dir. In there, I have a tf_files dir with my image folders.

I run Retrain.py from models-master, and it works fine. Spits out /bottlenecks /inception /retrained_labels.txt and /retrained_graph.pb in the tf_files folder.

Again from models-master, I run label_image.py as it is on "tensor flow for poets" tutorial:
https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/?utm_campaign=chrome_series_machinelearning_063016&utm_source=gdev&utm_medium=yt-desc#5

errors below:
(tensorflow) Benjamins-Mac-Pro:models-master tonysnark$ python3 label_image.py /Users/tonysnark/Downloads/20158069_10104845333160530_2508081536327318535_o.jpg Traceback (most recent call last): File "label_image.py", line 15, in <module> in tf.gfile.GFile("retrained_labels.txt")] File "label_image.py", line 14, in <listcomp> label_lines = [line.rstrip() for line File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 213, in __next__ return self.next() File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 207, in next retval = self.readline() File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 176, in readline self._preread_check() File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 78, in _preread_check compat.as_bytes(self.__name), 1024 * 512, status) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/contextlib.py", line 88, in __exit__ next(self.gen) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/errors_impl.py", line 466, in raise_exception_on_not_ok_status pywrap_tensorflow.TF_GetCode(status)) tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: retrained_labels.txt
body_text:
Thanks easye. I have a feeling it's a file structure problem...
I cd to a models-master dir. In there, I have a tf_files dir with my image folders.
I run Retrain.py from models-master, and it works fine. Spits out /bottlenecks /inception /retrained_labels.txt and /retrained_graph.pb in the tf_files folder.
Again from models-master, I run label_image.py as it is on "tensor flow for poets" tutorial:
https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/?utm_campaign=chrome_series_machinelearning_063016&utm_source=gdev&utm_medium=yt-desc#5
errors below:
(tensorflow) Benjamins-Mac-Pro:models-master tonysnark$ python3 label_image.py /Users/tonysnark/Downloads/20158069_10104845333160530_2508081536327318535_o.jpg Traceback (most recent call last): File "label_image.py", line 15, in <module> in tf.gfile.GFile("retrained_labels.txt")] File "label_image.py", line 14, in <listcomp> label_lines = [line.rstrip() for line  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 213, in __next__ return self.next() File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 207, in next retval = self.readline() File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 176, in readline self._preread_check() File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 78, in _preread_check compat.as_bytes(self.__name), 1024 * 512, status) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/contextlib.py", line 88, in __exit__ next(self.gen) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/errors_impl.py", line 466, in raise_exception_on_not_ok_status pywrap_tensorflow.TF_GetCode(status)) tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: retrained_labels.txt
body:
Thanks easye. I have a feeling it's a file structure problem...

I cd to a models-master dir. In there, I have a tf_files dir with my image folders.

I run Retrain.py from models-master, and it works fine. Spits out /bottlenecks /inception /retrained_labels.txt and /retrained_graph.pb in the tf_files folder.

Again from models-master, I run label_image.py as it is on "tensor flow for poets" tutorial:
https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/?utm_campaign=chrome_series_machinelearning_063016&utm_source=gdev&utm_medium=yt-desc#5

errors below:
`(tensorflow) Benjamins-Mac-Pro:models-master tonysnark$ python3 label_image.py /Users/tonysnark/Downloads/20158069_10104845333160530_2508081536327318535_o.jpg
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "label_image.py", line 15, in <module>
    in tf.gfile.GFile("retrained_labels.txt")]
  File "label_image.py", line 14, in <listcomp>
    label_lines = [line.rstrip() for line 
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 213, in __next__
    return self.next()
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 207, in next
    retval = self.readline()
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 176, in readline
    self._preread_check()
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/lib/io/file_io.py", line 78, in _preread_check
    compat.as_bytes(self.__name), 1024 * 512, status)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/contextlib.py", line 88, in __exit__
    next(self.gen)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/errors_impl.py", line 466, in raise_exception_on_not_ok_status
    pywrap_tensorflow.TF_GetCode(status))
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: retrained_labels.txt
`
